intro: Sisymbrium gilliesii, commonly known as the desert mustang grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its structure includes narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium gilliesii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native insects in its native range.
